alert.note: Alert for Plumas (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 15 at 3:12PM PDT until March 18 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in California... Middle Fork Feather River Near Portola affecting Plumas County. .Heavy rain fell on a deep primed snowpack earlier this week and is leading to a delayed melt with increased flows. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. For the Middle Fork Feather River...including Portola...Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SATURDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and will continue. This approaches the flood of record which is 4856.2 feet. * WHERE...Middle Fork Feather River Near Portola. * WHEN...Until early Saturday morning. * IMPACTS...At 4854.5 feet, Moderate flooding of businesses, homes, structures, and roads, including Highway 89 near Clio, portions of Highway 70, and low lying homes from Beckwourth to Clio. Impacts below Portola influenced by magnitude of tributary flows, especially Sulphur Creek. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 4853.8 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:30 PM PDT Wednesday was 4853.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 4854.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Friday morning. - Flood stage is 4852.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 4854.1 feet on 01/21/1969. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: This warning will be in effect until the river falls below its flood stage. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon at 400 PM PDT.
